purpose.p: The Attachment_slot module satisfies the requirement to track selected parts as an assembly and to note when some of those parts are not installed. A slot is used to represent the element on an assembly to which a part is or can be attached, when it is necessary to record the history of usage of that slot.
purpose.note: For the purposes of this standard, a part is either an indivisible component or an assembly of such components.
purpose.example: A ship has four engines each attached at a mounting point in an engine room. These mounting points are identified as slot 1, slot 2, slot 3, and slot 4. In normal usage only two engines are necessary, the remaining provide backup. The attached engines are tracked against their respective slots. If the ship does not have all of its engines installed, one or more slots are empty. An empty slot is subject to a different maintenance regime than an installed engine.

The pylon mounting on an aircraft wing is used to carry a radar, or fuel tank. The mounting is represented as a slot. The fatigue life of the slot will be determined differently depending on what is fitted and the duration of flying in that configuration.
purpose.p: A slot is used where there two parts are interfaced. If the details of this interface are required then the slot is associated with applicable )))interface connectors((( and )))interface specifications((( (ADD REFERENCE).

A slot has an identification, a version, and a definition. A slot may be a design, planned or realized. The slot definition relates the slot_on_part, the place on the part where the item will attach, to the part_in_slot.
A relationship between a slot_definition and a part_definition of a part_as_realized that indicates that a slot is occupied by the related part_as_realized.
The slot_on_part is a relationship between a slot_definition and a part_definition that represents that a slot is a slot on a particular part_actual or part_version.

inscope.p: All products or parts that have at least one physical interface, and there is a need to track selected items attached at that interface.

outscope.p: All products or parts that have no physical interface.
Products or parts that have a physical interface, but there is no requirement to track the item that is attached at that interface.
